Both kalibrs disappeared
Another group of Kh-101s in Vinnytsia Oblast changed course to the east, flying to Bila Tserkva/Fastiv.
2 groups in Cherkasy Oblast changed course to the north/northeast, also flying to Bila Tserkva District.
1 group in eastern Khmelnytskyi Oblast continues flying southwest.
3 groups from Cherkasy Oblast are flying west through central and southern Vinnytsia Oblast.
1 group is flying west/northwest through northwestern Vinnytsia Oblast.

Explosions in Nalyvaykivska, Kyiv Oblast.
Kh-101s are striking the 750 kV substation.
Explosions in Lutsk. Gerans

2 groups of Kh-101s are flying towards Bila Tserkva on a northwestern course (trajectory corrected from before).
1 group is flying west through northern Ternopil, towards Lviv Oblast.
1 group is flying south of Khmelnytskyi City on a southwestern course.
3 groups are flying west through western Vinnytsia Oblast towards eastern Khmelnytskyi Oblast.
4 groups of missiles impacted the same unknown target in southwestern Khmelnytskyi Oblast that the Kinzhals hit earlier.

Correction:
Only 2 groups impacted Khmelnytskyi Oblast.
1 group is flying northwest to Ternopil City.
1 group is bypassing Ternopil City from the north.
1 group is approaching Dobrotvir, Lviv Oblast from the east.

Correction:  Only 2 groups impacted Khmelnytskyi Oblast.  1 group is flying northwest to Ternopil City.  1 group is bypassing Ternopil City from the north.  1 group is approaching Dobrotvir, Lviv Oblast from the east.

2 groups of missiles also hit a target in Bila Tserkva District, Kyiv Oblast.
Not sure what yet.
Explosions in Dobrotvir, Lviv Oblast. Impacts to the Thermal Power Plant.
Explosions in Lutsk. Gerans
Gerans are still striking Lutsk

1 group of Kh-101s is approaching Burshtyn Thermal Power Plant in Ivano-Frankivsk Oblast from the east. 
1 group is approaching Dobrotvir power plant from the east/southeast.

1 group bypassed Burshtyn from the north and is approaching Stryi, Lviv Oblast.
no changes to the other group.
Explosions in Dobrotvir, Lviv Oblast. Impacts to the Thermal Power Plant.
Repeated explosions in Dobrotvir, Lviv Oblast. More Kh-101 impacts.
The last group of Kh-101s also impacted Dobrotvir Power Plant.

The missile attack is now over. More than 45 missiles of various types were used. I will publish a full report + the consequences later on. 
If you wish to support my work, you can do so here: 
https://buymeacoffee.com/amk_mapping
. 
Thank you for following along.

Last night and this morning, another large-scale, combined Russian missile and drone attack was carried out on Ukraine.
Missiles launched:
~30 Kh-101 cruise missiles from 9 Tu-95MS strategic bombers at their launch lines near the village of Uzmore, Saratov Oblast.
~5 Kalibr cruise missiles launched from 1 "Varshavyanka" Submarine at least 15 km off the coast from Cape Myskhako, Krasnodar Krai.
~5 Iskander-M ballistic missiles from OTRK installations southeast of Dzhankoi, Crimea.
~3 Iskander-M ballistic missiles from OTRK installations near Taganrog, Rostov Oblast.
~3 Iskander-M ballistic missiles from OTRK installations northwest of Klintsy, Bryansk Oblast.
~1 Iskander-M ballistic missile from an OTRK installations northeast of Simferopol, Crimea. 
~2 Kinzhal hypersonic aeroballistic missiles launched from 2 MiG-31K fighters at their launch lines in southwestern Ryazan Oblast.
~2 Kinzhal hypersonic aeroballistic missiles launched from 2 MiG-31K fighters at their launch lines Rasskazovsky District, Tambov Oblast.
-----------------------
Ukrainian air defence work:
As of the time of writing, Ukrainian air defence is confirmed to have intercepted 4 Kh-101s, 2 Kalibrs and 1 Iskander-M.
-----------------------
The main targets for this strike were Ukrainian energy infrastructure. The following was targeted:
Dobrotvir Thermal Power Plant, Lviv Oblast (50.21385, 24.37655) by ~8 Kh-101s.
"Kyiv" 750 kV Electrical Substation, Kyiv Oblast (50.49363, 29.69296) by ~5 Kh-101s and ~1 Kinzhal.
"Pivnichna" 330 kV Electrical Substation, Kyiv Oblast (50.61302, 30.38289) by ~3 Iskander-Ms (1 shot down on approach).
Industrial area containing multiple 150 kV Electrical Substations, Dnipropetrovsk Oblast (48.48005, 34.99807) by ~4 Kalibrs and ~2 Iskander-Ms (1 Kalibr shot down over Dnipro).
Kryvyi Rih Thermal Power Plant, Dnipropetrovsk Oblast (47.54282, 33.65892) by ~5 Iskander-Ms.
"Adzhalik" 330 kV Electrical Substation, Odesa Oblast (46.69939, 30.93175) by ~1 Iskander-M
Unknown target in southern Khmelnytskyi Oblast by ~6 Kh-101s and ~3 Kinzhals.
Unknown target northeast of Bila Tserkva, Kyiv Oblast by ~5 Kh-101s.  
Unknown target in southeastern Dnipro, Dnipropetrovsk Oblast by ~1 Iskander-M.
-----------------------
Additional places targeted by Geran-2 drones, but not by missiles, include:
Kyiv City, Kyiv Oblast.
Fastiv, Kyiv Oblast.
Bila Tserkva, Kyiv Oblast.
Vyshhorod, Kyiv Oblast.
Lutsk City, Lutsk Oblast.
Unknown area near Lutsk City,
Poltava City, Poltava Oblast.
Dubovyky/Medychne, Dnipropetrovsk Oblast.
Pavlohrad, Dnipropetrovsk Oblast
Shakhtarske area, Dnipropetrovsk Oblast.
Petropavlivka area, Dnipropetrovsk Oblast.
Vasylkivka, Dnipropetrovsk Oblast.
Chernihiv City, Chernihiv Oblast.
Multiple unknown settlements near Koryukivka, Chernihiv Oblast.
Vicinity of Kramatorsk, Donetsk Oblast.
Vicinity of Zaporizhzhia City, Zaporizhzhia Oblast.
Shepetivka, Khmelnytskyi Oblast.
Lviv City, Lviv Oblast.
Silets, Lviv Oblast.
Stryi area, Lviv Oblast.
Sheptytskyi area, Lviv Oblast.
Busk area, Lviv Oblast.
Ladyzhyn, Vinnytsia Oblast.
Unknown area in Rivne Oblast.
Pivdenne, Odesa Oblast.
Nove, Kharkiv Oblast.
Izyum, Kharkiv Oblast. 
Korobchyne, Kharkiv Oblast.
Martynivka area, Kharkiv Oblast.
Voznesensk area, Mykolaiv Oblast.
Zolotonosha area, Cherkasy Oblast.
Additionally, MLRS and artillery strikes were carried out on energy infrastructure south of Zaporizhzhia City, near Znachkove (Zaporizhzhia Oblast - 750 kV substation), and in Kherson City.
Keep in mind, the numbers of missiles launched may be slightly higher than what I've listed, as the number of missiles detected is often lower than actual launches.
A large fire continues to burn at an industrial zone in Dnipro after it was targeted by Russian cruise missiles, ballistic missiles, and Geran-2 drones.
A large fire continues to burn at an industrial zone in Dnipro after it was targeted by Russian cruise missiles, ballistic missiles, and Geran-2 drones.
Footage showing one of several Russian Geran-2 drone strikes on the combined heat and power plant in the city of Bila Tserkva, Kyiv Oblast.
Widespread destruction seen at Fastiv Railway Station in Kyiv Oblast after it was struck by more than a dozen Russian Geran-2 drones overnight.
Widespread destruction seen at Fastiv Railway Station in Kyiv Oblast after it was struck by more than a dozen Russian Geran-2 drones overnight.

Russian Strikes Soften Ukrainian Defenses In Huliaipole Ahead Of Large Assault (Videos)
The Russian military has intensified strikes on the key city of Huliaipole and its outskirts in Zaporozhye likely in preparation of a large-scale assault, videos from December 5 and previous days show.
In the last few days, the Vostok [East] Group of Forces, which leads operations in this direction, captured the last two settlements to the east of Huliaipole, Zelenyi Hai and Vysoke, from Kiev forces.
The group also broke through Ukrainian defenses along the Haichur River to the north of the city, capturing Dobropillya and storming Varvarivka. Fierce fighting is currently taking place in the latter, with preliminary reports indicating that at least the northern part of the large settlement has been already secured.
üëâ

When Morale Breaks: Inside Ukraine‚Äôs Failing War Machine
The Russian army‚Äôs strategy is gradually bearing fruit. The Ukrainian army‚Äôs tactical crises are turning into operational ones. Four years of intense conflict are taking their toll on Ukrainian troops. They are becoming less and less motivated to fight.
High-intensity armed conflicts cannot last for decades. The examples of World Wars I and II confirm this, as one of the warring parties suffered defeat due to the depletion of necessary resources. For countries waging wars of this type, having vital reserves is critically important. This was one of the key reasons for Germany‚Äôs defeat.
Russia and Ukraine‚Äôs military capabilities are not comparable in scale. Even disregarding nuclear weapons, Kyiv‚Äôs conventional forces are significantly inferior to Moscow‚Äôs. However, besides troops, dozens of factors determine the success of a war. 
üëâ
 Read more 
HERE

Russian Army Broke Through Key Ukrainian Defense Line In Siversk
On December 5, the Russian military‚Äôs Yug [South] Group of Forces broke through a key Ukrainian defense line within the city of the Siversk in Donetsk.
The line, which includes strong fortifications, lies along the eastern part of Siversk. After breaking through the line, Russian troops managed to expand their control in the eastern part of the city, even reaching the multi-story residential area on Energetikov Street which oversees all nearby areas.
Following the breakthrough, some Ukrainian news sources began to sound the alarm over the catastrophic situation in Siversk.
Ukrainian troops held up in the city lost their last main supply route a few days earlier when the Yug Group of Forces stormed Sviato-Pokrovske to the south and cut the T-05-13 road. The city is not besieged yet, but bringing in supplies is getting harder by the day.
üëâ

U.S. Strategy Shift and Russian-Ukrainian Strikes on December 4-5 (Videos) 
On December 4-5, Russian and Ukrainian forces continued to exchange strikes. According to the Russian Defense Ministry, during the night of December 5, Russian air defense systems intercepted and destroyed 41 Ukrainian unmanned aerial vehicles over several regions. A statement from the Ukrainian Air Force reported that on the same night, Russia employed 137 attack UAVs, of which 80 were shot down or suppressed by Ukrainian air defense and electronic warfare assets.
These developments unfolded against the backdrop of the published update to the U.S. National Security Strategy, wherein Washington's foreign policy priorities were revised. According to the document, the U.S. administration considers achieving a swift end to the conflict in Ukraine to be a vital interest, aimed at stabilizing the European economy, preventing escalation, and restoring strategic stability in relations with Russia. 
üëâ

HERE

From Myrnohrad To Rodinskoye: Russia Develops Offensive On Ukraine‚Äôs Northern Flank
Russian units have advanced to Donetska Street in the northeastern outskirts of Huliaipole and approached the Haichur River. The Ukrainian grouping in Siversk is practically paralyzed due to the loss of control over the main logistical routes to the north and south of the city. 
The U.S. administration is lobbying against the EU's plans to provide Kyiv with a substantial loan for 2026‚Äì2027.

U.S. Praises Syria For Seizing Hezbollah Weapons Shipments (Photos)
Adm. Brad Cooper, the commander of the United States Central Command, on December 5 congratulated Syrian security forces on seizing weapon shipments bound to Hezbollah in Lebanon, in a sign of growing collaboration between Washington and Damascus.
‚ÄúCongratulations to Syria's security forces for recently interdicting multiple weapons shipments. These shipments were intended for Lebanese Hezbollah,‚Äù Cooper said in a brief statement published by the command on X.
In recent days, Syria security forces seized two weapons prepared for smuggling into Lebanon. The first shipment was made up of over 1,200 landmines and was seized near the town of Yabroud in the southern governorate of Rif Dimashq. The other included rocket-propelled grenade launchers, sniper rifles and various other arms. It was captured close to the town of Qusaer in the central governorate of Homs.
Read more
